channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Inside Story of How Gen Z Toppled Nepal’s Leader and Chose a New One on Discord
item.description: The revolution started on social media. It ended with protests, violence, and an online poll to pick the new prime minister.

item.title: a16z pauses its famed TxO Fund for underserved founders, lays off staff
item.description: Andreessen Horowitz is pausing its Talent x Opportunity (TxO) fund and program, according to multiple sources.

item.title: What’s the Deal With Okapa’s $300 Water Bottle?
item.description: Eight years of research and 10,000 prototypes have created a luxury water bottle claiming to redefine the experience of drinking H2O, all for an eye-w...

item.title: Best Packing Cubes for Every Kind of Trip (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Whether you’re a no-frills backpacker or a bag-checking fashionista, there’s a perfect packing cube out there for you.

item.title: A New Type of Opioid Is Killing People in the US, Europe, and Australia
item.description: Nitazenes, a class of synthetic drugs 40 times more potent than fentanyl, are steadily becoming more common on both sides of the Atlantic.

item.title: Wait, people actually use Facebook Dating?
item.description: Meta said that Facebook Dating has 1.77 million daily active users in the US between ages 18-29.

item.title: Kara Swisher Would Rather Work for Sam Altman Than Mark Zuckerberg
item.description: But ideally, the journalist and podcast host would rather not work for tech CEOs at all.

item.title: Studio Ghibli and other Japanese publishers want OpenAI to stop training on their work
item.description: OpenAI's approach to working with copyrighted content is to ask forgiveness, not permission.

item.title: Lawmakers say stolen police logins are exposing Flock surveillance cameras to hackers
item.description: Flock said around 3% of its law enforcement customers do not use multi-factor authentication, potentially leaving dozens of law enforcement agency acc...

item.title: Elad Gil on which AI markets have winners — and which are still wide open
item.description: Over the last year, certain AI markets appear to be nearly sewn up by startup market leaders. But beyond these areas, a vast swath of AI remains anyon...
